Reviews.Title: “Read this first!... if you don't want the same frigid reception we received from Ramada Metrotown ...”
Reviews.Author: Eric C
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon this hotel at Kingsway and Tyne, ( 3484 Kingsway , Vancouver ) after having a super fun night out on town, delighted to learn that a room was available for the night. A reasonable rate for a Queen Sized bed Suite, Room 343, which included complimentary breakfast and free WiFi. Upon our entrance of the suite, we noticed it was cold inside, almost as cold as the 5-degree February weather we had just escaped.  No problem, we thought - we turned on the room heating system and settled in.  It was a clean and attractively decorated room, with a bathroom that invited a nice warm shower.  A hotter-than usual shower setting is what we needed to offset the cold room. So, we indulged in this after watching t.v. for 30 minutes.   It was to our dismay that we soon learned the room was still cold; what a contrast in temperature, from a hot shower to a bedroom that was still cold!  The air from the heater was only slightly warm after one hour.  A phone call to the front desk gave rise to a smirky response from the tired-sounding front desk clerk, who replied that I should have started at a lower heat setting first and then gradually move it up to high after 30 minutes. { Oh yes, I SHOULD have known to do it this way}.  And so we persevered under his instructions.  The next 30 minutes of igloo living seemed like frozen hell, at 1:30am. Finally, with a bit of frustration boiling over, I went to the front desk and tried hard to inquire "nicely" about a portable space heater.  Oh, what's that, they have all been taken?  Ok, I then asked for an extra set of blankets.  Sheepishly handed over.  Wow, what initiative! Customer service initiated by myself.  This tired front-desk clerk was not about to use any energy to come up with suggestions, like the ones I just conjured up. Back to the room... And so, our tired minds and bodies gave in to sleep, under heavy layers of blankets which barely fought off the cold around us.  We were able to sleep until the time to enjoy the complimentary breakfast which was waiting for us in the morning. In fact, we barely just got in. Actually the toast-eggs-bacon-and coffee was super!  That, I can say was the best part of the hotel stay!   Talking to the new - and much different - front desk clerk this next morning, I mentioned our frigid reception.  He was most apologetic and conceded the fact that management had had some previous similar complaints about the night clerk as well.  In fact, just that same morning, the night clerk had been observed hanging up on a guest who had telephoned to give some constructive feedback!  The morning clerk also said that he would have also suggested moving us to anothe room, if it were him attending to us. We won't be visiting this hotel for a while. A month later, I dropped in in the afternoon and talked to a South-Asian-looking front desk gentleman, inquiring if they had received our written feedback.   Wow, what an apathetic response.  I might as well have been talking to a robot.  I pulled out the hotel receipt to show the date and hotel room, and he didn't even pretend to take any notice of it.  He just said, yes, all feedback is read by management, and any training issues on a specific individual would be looked into. Sorry, Ramada Hotel Metrotown, your chance to exonerate yourself was lost. More Vancouver experiences at www.tinyurl.com/ramadametrotown

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Gary M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property last weekend and have never stayed at the Ramada brand before but thought I would give it a chance because for around $80 you get a nice clean room, with free breakfast, free wifi and free parking. Now that's a deal! Service was great. Staff was friendly. Good area. Very clean place. Will come back next time I'm in beautiful Vancouver city. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Intensive Studies at BCIT - perfect B&B!”
Reviews.Author: Jan W
Reviews.Content: Ramada Metrotown is 5 minutes from BCIT - quiet location, nicely decorated rooms, GREAT shower massage and comfy beds. Great rates (weekly available) for intensive studies at BCIT or working downtown. Free parking and great coffee. Couldn't ask for a better combination!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price savy”
Reviews.Author: Sportsmum123
Reviews.Content: I stayed over the Grey cup weekend. At first I thought the location might be too far from the game however I was pleasantly surprised at how convenient it was given that the sky train was a short ten minute walk to station. What a great way to see the city. We got upgraded to a suite and the rooms looked immaculate. We were thrilled with what we got for the price we paid. We will definitely come back on our next trip hopefully for the playoffs.

Reviews.Title: “USA & Canada Trip”
Reviews.Author: lizziemartie
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bed room suite here & it was great - by mistake I have reviewed Downtown Ramada too - sorry - we didn't stay there! This hotel is great to site see Vancouver from - Vancouver a bit disappointing - run down in parts - lots of homeless. However Vancouver Aquarium fantastic - great shows, Stanley Park beautiful esp nice restaurant there. Go whale watching if you get the chance too Pool 10 feet deep at one end - my little boy as we are is a strong swimmer but it was a bit deep - take care with that - however a lovely stay - recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Tour of USA & Canada”
Reviews.Author: lizziemartie
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect hotel in the heart of Vancouver for exploring the city - we stayed in a 2 bedroom suite - great facilities - pool fun but very deep at the one end - 10 foot! Even though our little boy is an excellent swimmer, as we are, we were a little uneasy with the depth of the pool. However a great stay with everything you needed. Vancouver City disappointing - backdrop gorgeous, Stanley Park gorgeous & a couple of streets pretty but overall a bit run down - a lot of homeless people - not what we expected. Interesting to see though - go whale watching if you get the chance - overall a great stay. Also eat at the very nice restaurant in Stanley Park - beautiful food.

Reviews.Title: “Good cheap place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elclemen
Reviews.Content: No frills but a clean quiet place to stay. This hotel is located in a Korean neighborhood so most of the food is Korean but pizza by the slice is available at some local shops. The Safeway is across the parking lot so you can get some food to keep in the mini-fridge. Coffee maker provided but no cups. Staff was ok, not the friendliest but not rude. If you have extra people be prepared to pay extra at the desk, even if the site you booked on did not allow you to select # of guests. 15 minute walk to the train station, good value. I would stay here again for the price. The attached restaurant is never open it seems. Food does not look that great.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: CELHongkong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one week visiitng friends in Vancouver. We booked through the hotel's website to make sure that we got the best deal. It is situtaed along the Kingway and only 5 minutes by bus or 1.5 Skytrain stations to Metrotown. By bus route no. 19, it is only 30 minutes from Vancouver downtown or 45 minutes from Stanley Park. Don't let the name fool you, according to the fare zone, it belongs to Zone 1 i.e. Vancouver and Metrotown is in Burnaby. If you travelled to Metrotown, you would require ticket for two zones. When we checked in, we were greetd by a young man and took him a little bit of time to find out our reservation. The hotel corridor and room looked a bit old and should require renovation very soon. Romm amenities are baisc. They have a outdoor pool opened during Summer time and laundry room for hotel guest. We picked this hotel due to its location for public transportation and foods. You have Safeway and liquor store next door which are open until mid-night. Starbuck is opposite and along the Kingsway you have plenty of Chinese and Asian restaurants and stores to choose from. There ae other similar choices of hotel/inn along the Kingsway which are closer to the downtown, I would recommend this hotel due to its location.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: YH2011
Reviews.Content: I stayed 2 nights and 1 night. The rooms were cozy except creaky front doors. Other than rooms I felt that they might reduce cost for mainteance. My booking included free continental breakfasts but a receptionist did not recognize that. It was the hotel’s fault. At my second stay a female receptionist told me that there should not be any losses for me because breakfasts were complimentary. She never showed apologies which annoyed me.

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tronlets
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 2 nights over the long weekend and was pleasantly surprised with rooms and service. The hotel was the best deal in the area compared to what was close by.There is a nice outdoor pool with lots of seating area so you can swim or read a book while sitting in the sun. There is a sports bar in hotel so if you want to watch a game or get something to eat it's very convenient. A good deal for what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price and you're a heavy sleeper”
Reviews.Author: winspenelli
Reviews.Content: Pros: Lots of (mostly Chinese) restaurants nearby, grocery (Safeway) store across street, free parking, free wifi, 15-minute walk from Skytrain station, non-smoking rooms. Cons: Very thin walls, peeling paint on bathroom ceiling, preset thermostat you cannot control (very annoying), basic bedding and towels. Generally clean and decent for what I paid for 3 nights. Front desk staff pleasant. Not being able to adjust the room temperature was strange. The front desk said it is preset and not adjustable. I had a single room with queen.

Reviews.Title: “Old, cheap, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: SoCalSll
Reviews.Content: The positive first: The staff is very friendly and helpful and the hotel is reasonably cheap. The biggest plus is the really fast WiFi. Most other upscale places I stayed for business have a painfully slow connection. Not this place. Also, this hotel has nice tick walls. I was right on top of the bar they have on the ground floor and the hallways were quite loud. However, as soon as I closed the room door it was quiet. As many other have stated, this hotel has seen its days. The room bed and bath are clean, but somewhat run down. The wall paper is has loose edges, the grout in the bath has been painted and the paint is coming off and the day cover for the bed had a burn hole in it (so much for no smoking room). The hotel is right next to a large and Safeway grocery store and a liquor store and the room has a decent size fridge, so I was covered there. Other than that, there are tons of Asian restaurants around and 2 Starbucks within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Family.”
Reviews.Author: raynersgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 room suite with a kitchenette. Room was very clean. Beds were very comfortable! Kids loved it, had there own TV!. And free wireless internet. Free parking was a bonus. Hotel has a restaurant, we all enjoyed our daily breakfast, tastefully prepared by Narinder. There are lots of shops and restaurants in the neighbourhood. Easy access to Children's Hospital, as our visit was for appointments there. We have booked a cruise to Alaska in July 2011, and plan to stay in Vancouver on our return, and have already booked our rooms with Ramada Metrotown.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sicamous
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a weekend here recently. We travel to Vancouver once or twice a year and will likely make this our choice in future. The rooms are clean and comfortable, and we appreciated the good lighting in the room. Other pluses were a fridge, coffee maker, ironing board, and hairdryer. Parking is free. Good value for the price. On this visit (our first) the front desk called us in the evening to inform us that the parking lot security man had noticed some small items (not of great value) on the floor of our car and recommended that we remove them from sight to prevent a break-in. We certainly appreciated this.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: snapngo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise left from the Vancouver port. The rates for the hotels downtown were a lot higher so we opted for this location based on TripAdvisor reviews - $99 for the night. It's about a 10 minute walk from the Skytrain through a mostly residential neighborhood. (Note: I think the hotel has a shuttle to the Skytrain - call for info.) The hotel itself is in a neighborhood with lots of dining choices - there's a Papa John's and Subway down the street, a Safeway right across the street, and lots of Asian restaurants in the area. The room had 2 double beds, TV, wireless internet, fridge, phone, coffeemaker, and nice toiletries. The room looked like it had been newly remodeled, but the hallway and elevators could probably use a freshening up. There's no free breakfast, but there is a restaurant just off the lobby. Oddly, there was a power outage during our stay. One lady was stuck in the elevator, but they got her out quickly. Power was out for about two hours in the area - not the hotel's fault. Staff were very nice during the whole visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!”
Reviews.Author: guibox
Reviews.Content: This 3 night stay started off pretty much as a 2 star when we got to our room, and ended up as a 4 which is why I have given it a 3 star review. This was mostly in part to the excellent customer service at this hotel! When we arrived the desk clerk (an Asian man with glasses) greeted us and was most excellent at check in. He gave us information on good eating spots and answered any questions we had. (Ramada, if you are reading this, you know who he is. Give the man a raise! He is great!) ROOM PROBLEMS The hallways seem a bit shabby and outdated but the room was more sophisticated and clean. It had a mini-fridge and coffee maker which was great! From the get-go, however, we had problems with the air-conditioner. First of all, it was high up on the wall. It didn't throw out cool air and there was no way to adjust the temperature. You could only turn if on and off by a light switch on the wall. It began to leak and it leaked all night. No, it practically poured all night! It leaked all over the rug and end table. The floor was soaked and we knew we didn't want to stay in that room anymore! The next morning we heard a grinding, sickening clunk and the A/C chuckled weakly and died. We had to be on our way to a meeting for the whole day and mentioned the problem to the desk. They said that they would see if it could be fixed and if not, we would have to be moved to another room. When we came back late that afternoon, we found out that they upgraded us to a 1BD suite at no extra cost! That was such an awesome thing to do! Again, the staff at the desk were polite, helpful and even asked us how things were every time we'd walk by at later times! 1 BD SUITE Folks, the 1 BD suites are THE way to go. I would spend the extra money next time to get it instead of the regular room. In addition to the extra space, there is also a microwave and two televisions. The bedding is WAY more comfortable than the regular rooms. It was thick and plush where as the regular rooms simply had plain sheets and a thin comforter. It is in another wing of the hotel with a different elevator. The suite section was much more isolated and quiet. At least it seemed that way to me. The A/C was a large unit located under the window with all kinds of adjustments to be made and NO leaks! We enjoyed this upgrade very much and if I stayed there again, I'd take the suite! FACILITIES The pool looked nice though we never had the chance to use it. We ordered food from the pub and it was reasonably priced and good. LOCATION The location is really good. You are not far from most of the things to do. It is located on Kingsway which takes you (or leads you to roads) where you need to go. It is only minutes from Metrotown Mall. There is a Safeway and a liquor store parallell to it, a Subway a half block down the other side, a Starbucks across the street and another down a few blocks. Many, many Asian restaraunts across the street and down the street for a few blocks. Overall, I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - recommend !”
Reviews.Author: Nomad_1711
Reviews.Content: I have nothing to gain or lose from this review and have no ties whatsoever to this hotel ! Hubby and I stayed for two nights during a weekend trip to beautiful Vancouver. The hotel is easily reached from YVR airport by Canada Line - transfer @ City Center to Sky Train/Expo Line >> King George and get off @ Joyce Street exit. From here it's about a 7 min walk. Hotel is unpretentious, somewhat dated and set in a basically Asian neighborhood. Room was clean, basic but comfy. People were very friendly and helpful. We did not feel unsafe at all - even at night - while roaming the neighborhood for places to eat. Metrotown Mall is a 15 min walk or next SkyTrain station. Excellent place to just spend comfy nights while roaming the City at daytime and will definitely return to this value-for-money location !

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: uhuru1963
Reviews.Content: My business meetings were at Glelyon Parkway and also at a co. located in/nearDiscovery park. This hotel location was ideal. Close to both meeting places. Rooms were veery clean. Very helpfull staff. The heater in my room started blowing cold air, in the middle of the night. I called the desk, and a young fellow came up right away, and fix the problem. Next morning the front desk staff and the housekeeping staff asked me if I was comfortable after the heat problem! Hotel has a business, came in handy when I had to prepare for my presentation. Laptops can do only so much. Good food and good service in the Jaguar's Bar and Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good people, great price!”
Reviews.Author: chrisKelowna_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unprepossessing from the outside but quite clean and well appointed. The people who work there are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is on a main road and only a couple of blocks away from a Sky Train station. The price is very good for a hotel of this quality and we've stayed here quite often. There is no breakfast included in the price, but there is a pub on site that opens for breakfast. There is a small fridge in the room but no microwave. There is a Starbucks across the street and a Safeway. On this trip, we checked in early but were given a room anyway. It was a really big room with a door to a private balcony. That seemed fabulous but we found out in the evening that the room was quite cold. We called the desk and asked for an extra blanket and within five minutes, a maintenance man appeared with a blanket, a space heater, and he came to adjust the heat. Although the response was very quick, we found in the night that the door didn't have a great seal and it was COLD in our room all night! In the morning, we asked for a change and were given a key to the room across the hall, which was ready immediately. We had changed rooms in about fifteen minutes and the new room was warm and cosy. There were no other problems. We were impressed with how quickly and positively staff responsed. We've stayed here before and will stay again. Thanks Ramada Metrotown!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: ButtercupDallas
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience staying at the Ramada Metrotown and Suites. The hotel is in a great location close to the biggest shopping mall Metrotown as well as a close to the skytrain which drops you off right in downtown in a mere 12 minutes. The hotel even offers free shuttle service during the week to Metrotown and the skytrain station. I recommend this hotel not only for the price but the cleanliness, friendly staff and amazing pub food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: well_travelled0707
Reviews.Content: I often booked Ramada for my trip to Vancouver. I found great value and convenience in this hotel. My rooms are always clean and the staffs are always kind and polite. Some of them even getting to know me now and often offer a free room upgrade when ever they can. The suite has large bay window with lots of natural lights and the separate living room also allow me with plenty spaces to work. The restaurant and pub offer extensive menu selection, but there are also lots of choices of eatery in the area. I highly recommend this hotel for those on the budget but need a clean room with restful overnight stays.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Bugged By This One”
Reviews.Author: capercanuk
Reviews.Content: The company travel agent booked this for me for my visit to Vancouver and after hearing I would be staying in a Ramada hotel, I was relieved. That soon crumbled when I saw the building. Walking into the hotel, I could tell we overpaid by a lot. Getting into the elevator for the first time, I was bombarded by a horrible stench. Thinking I would relax in bed with a little television after a long drive, I was not happy when I realized all the buttons on the remote control were not working properly (the channels only went up and the volume only went down no matter what button I pressed). The creme de la creme however were the itchy bites I would wake up with for the first two mornings. I was convinced I had bed bugs in my bed, and I was right! They were clumped in the corners of matress and they were feasting on me during the night. I went to the front desk immediately with some critters in a cup of water and teh man at the desk moved me into another room, but told me that they had had the fumigator there twice already and he couldn't believe they put me in that room when they knew it was a problem one. I was thoroughly disappointed with the quality of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: boysmomma
Reviews.Content: oh my God!!!! Stay away!!!!! We only stayed there because we were desperate!!! I think they should have paid us to stay. I am only 5'8' abd my feet were hanging off the bed which was the smallest double bed I have ever seen!! It smelled it was dirty it was falling apart. It was loud and the men at the counter were rude do your self a favor and keep looking,

Reviews.Title: “Room fine but location far from central.”
Reviews.Author: cambridgefox
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the middle of a refurb to brighten up the exterior and lobby area. Room was comfortable and quiet and air-con a welcome addition. Adjoining pub was a bit downmarket but the food was very good value for money. You really need a car to use the hotel as a base for exploring the city - its quiet a walk to the Skytrain.

Reviews.Title: “Not very nice”
Reviews.Author: hockeydad2BC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel as part of a group in Vancouver for a hockey tournament. The pool was empty, the elevator was broken and the staff were very snotty. The kids had nothing to do so they ended up in the parking lot with the used needles from the patrons of the "retro" bar. The rooms are small and the beds tiny. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Even the food from the restaurant was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality; plenty of restaurants, etc.”
Reviews.Author: hardcorecanada
Reviews.Content: Nothing too special, but I was worried after reading some of the negative feedback here. This place was a great bang for your buck. Close to the Skylink, 10-15 minutes to downtown, etc. I am a frequenter to Vancouver and I will definitely stay here again. The pool was COLD, though...LOL.

Reviews.Title: “Well the old saying sure holds true... "You get what you pay for."”
Reviews.Author: BuffaloTravelingMan
Reviews.Content: Aside from the fact that the hotel was relatively inexpensive and convenient to where I had to be on town, my stay was terrible. I stayed in room 213. The room was small, cold, too much noise heard from outside and other rooms, leaky faucet in the bathroom, electrical outlets that did not work, and extremely unclean! It made me sick watching housekeeping attempting to clean my room. I mean is it common practice for pillows with clean pillow cases on them to be layed on the disgusting dirty and smelly floor as the bed is being made, and may I ad being made as in the sheets never being changed. How about after your bathroom is cleaned ie: toilet, tub, floor, etc, the housekeeper uses there same dirty and disgusting hands to give you fresh towels... Well at least I hope they were fresh. They never once vacuumed the room even though they had it waiting on there cart ready to use. I could honestly write my name in the dust on basically any piece of furniture in the room. This was just disgusting and very unclean. To top it off I'm still waiting for the Ramada to address any of my issues which I suppose they have chosen to ignore. I guess customer service and a sanitary enviroment just isn't in there company's business plans...

Reviews.Title: “Back in the Neighborhoods -- Back to Basics”
Reviews.Author: Forest20851
Reviews.Content: This hotel is divided into two wings -- each with its own access elevator from the lobby. There is an executive-suite wing for business travelers, and another wing for regular vacationers. I stayed in the regular wing on the third floor with non-smoking rooms. But my third-floor companions included traveling business people, tourists in town for the holidays, and out-of-town family members put up at the hotel as overflow guests from neighborhood holiday celebrations. The hotel is easy to find in eastern Vancouver on Kingsway at Tyne Street -- in the Collingwood neighborhood -- and five blocks west of the Metrotown regional shopping district (which is right across the city line in Burnaby). Since you have to change busses to get downtown, people who really want to be in center city wouldn't be happy here. But the bus that runs on Kingway connects to almost everywhere. I did not dine at Jaguars, the restaurant attached to the Ramada. But the fact is, I counted about 80 different small restaurants on Kingway in both directions from the hotel. Whatever cuisine you want, if you look, you will find it. My room had all the basics. Nothing was elaborate or fancy, but everything necessary for a good night's sleep was there. I took some photos of my room which should be attached to this review.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great room”
Reviews.Author: ArcticCold
Reviews.Content: The front of the hotel and lobby didn't look as nice as expected, but the room itself was great. One of the most comfortable beds I've slept on in a long time. The hotel is NOT at Metrotown, wait for any bus coming by to get to a Skytrain station in a few minutes, or about a 15 block walk. A Safeway (you can buy a daypass for the transit system there) and Liquor store accross the street, lots of decent asian restaurants nearby, two Starbucks within 1/2 block. They lock the doors at night, you have to buzz or knock really loud if you are out late. Good place to stay, especially if you are driving

Reviews.Title: “I'd definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: need2win
Reviews.Content: I cannot complain about this hotel. There was excellent parking in a well lit area so I wasn't nervous at night. There's a Safeway across the street so you can buy some groceries to make breakfast & pack lunches. The mini fridge was clean & worked fine. The hotel's right on Kingsway so access to main routes is great. Metrotown is a 5 minute drive away. I'm not sure how convenient this hotel would be if you don't rent a car. We were on the third floor facing the east so the room wasn't noisy. There are a few rooms that you may ask not to stay in due to noise factors: ask to be away from the drink machine and the elevator. The staff were very friendly & always smiling. The fitness center has a treadmill, eliptical & recumbant bike along with a weight bench. Our rooms were spotless each day. There's a computer in the lobby which guests can access at no charge.The lounge had decent daily food specials & a pleasant atmosphere. We previously stayed at the Holiday Inn Metrotown. It was a nicer hotel overall, but it was almost double the price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: heatherbennett_123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awful. We stayed there in August of 2005. In their defence, they may have cleaned it up since. This is no lie, there was dried vomit on the floor of one of the rooms. The stench of cigarette smoke and yellow walls was not dealt with until I asked the ladies to clean the room and change the bed spread. (Not their fault, they were doing as they were required to by their employers.) I had no idea we were getting a smoking room. (My son has asthma). The door going up to the floors had a deadbolt on it, to stop the "evening traffic" from going upstairs. The Safeway across the road said they has to take all the payphones out due to activity and "transactions" going on in the neighborhood. Again, the photos are misleading. I used some trip rewards to get our rooms, and YES, I got them refunded to my account. It took months, but the manager finally gave them back to me. It might be better now, who knows, front desk told me to check out if the room did not meet with my approval. Nice attitude. Do your research. If you are a Ramada Fan, go to Penticton. Stay away from Metrotown.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, didn't like this place”
Reviews.Author: Scotourist
Reviews.Content: This booking was a mistake! Way too far out of town for us but ideal if you want to go to the huge shopping mall. Thankfully we only had one night booked here. The fridge in our room still contained a half-eaten Chinese takeaway from a previous guest! The area was not a tourist area. The staff were not particularly helpful or courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Clean comfortable room and staff very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very positive experience. After reading the other reviews I requested on line to have a quiet room. I could not have asked for better. The housekeeping was great, bed comfortable and Santish the day front end person was wonderful and even pre-boarded me for my flight home. Could not have asked for better service. I will be back in September.

Reviews.Title: “Good, economical hotel for travellers”
Reviews.Author: Perwf
Reviews.Content: A safe, clean and reasonably economical hotel outside the city centre. Ideal if you want a base to sleep or rest but will mainly be out seeing the sights and are not after a luxury experience. My room was a good size with TV, drink maker etc - all I needed. The name implies it is near Metrotown shopping centre but it is not. Even so it was in 5-10 minutes walk of Joyce skytrain station which gets you to the City Centre in 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't have the same experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place was horrible. The 'restaurant' was open quite late and the noise in my room kept me up until 2am. The bathroom tiles looked as though they were going to come off any time. The front desk person was really rude, and told me tough luck that my room didn't have high speed internet access, I would need my own dial up ISP for that. I asked to switch rooms and pay more but was told there was nothing available and that was that. When I asked for a number to call to complain, he gave me the wrong one! Because of his attitude, I checked out the next day. Watch out when you book, there seems to be two wings to the hotel, the 'cheap' rooms and the 'suites'. I bet if you can get into the suites it would be better but the service by the night staff was atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: RedZinger
Reviews.Content: Of the four hotels I stayed at in Vancouver and Victoria, the Ramada Inn Metrotown provided me with the best accomodations. The room was large, comfortable, quiet, and clean. I requested a basic room at the cheapest rate and got a two room suite with a queen bed in one room and a fold out couch queen sized bed in the second room. Both rooms had televisions. There was an alcove between the rooms with refrigerator, microwave, cabinets, coffee maker, and kitchen sink. The hotel provides free parking which is something I expect without thinking about it; however, I found out that Vancouver hotels frequently charge extra for parking. There was a free breakfast buffet consisting of toast, mini-muffins, and bagels with peanut butter, jelly, and margarine to put on them and of course, tea and coffee, but no decaf was available. For an extra fee of $4 there were pancakes, scrambled eggs and various fried pork products. This hotel is excellent for anyone traveling to Vancouver on a budget. It is located in the Asian community, a short 20 minutes away from downtown Vancouver and Granville Island and well worth the stay.
